intro: Hieracium subclavatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. The plant features basal rosettes of narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers in clusters during the summer months. Its flowering stems are usually unbranched and can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters. Hieracium subclavatum is part of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
